caption.p: Histological preparations of intestine (ematoxylin-eosin staining) of fingerling common carp after feeding experimental diets with graded levels of neroli oil (0â€“1.5%) for 60 days. ( A) Lamina propria cell infiltration and hyperemia in the submucosa (NO 0.25). ( B) Cell infiltration (black arrows) in the submucosa (NO 0.50). ( C) Cell infiltration in the lamina propria and submucosa (black arrows) and hyperemia in the submucosa (NO 1). ( D, E) Lamina propria, severe cell infiltration in the submucosa (black arrows) and hyperemia (NO 1.5).
